result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie L Wilkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. Medication assisted treatment allowed. No contact with the victims outlined in complaints. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie L Wilkins

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Willie L Wilkins in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. Defendant asks to address bond. 
State indicates victim notification has not been given.
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits. Court cannot hear bond today, will address bond at the next date. 
Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Not sufficient time to appoint, 0 attempts made

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim K.L.S (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Willie L Wilkins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Willie L Wilkins. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
